meanings.definition: A gift of personal property by will.
meanings.sent1: In his will, he left a bequest of his favorite watch to his grandson.
meanings.sent2: The bequest of her antique jewelry collection was a generous gesture.
meanings.sent3: The bequest of the old, creaky chair brought unexpected joy to the family.
meanings.sent4: Her bequest of wisdom to the next generation will always be cherished.
meanings.sent5: The bequest of the magical ring held great power and mystery.

meanings.sent1: The lawyer oversaw the bequest of the family heirlooms.
meanings.sent2: Her bequest of the estate was carried out according to her wishes.
meanings.sent3: The bequest of the secret recipe was met with excitement and curiosity.
meanings.sent4: His bequest of knowledge to his students was his greatest legacy.
meanings.sent5: The bequest of the ancient map led to a thrilling adventure.

meanings.definition: Something that is bequeathed; a legacy.
meanings.sent1: The bequest of the rare painting was a valuable addition to the museum.
meanings.sent2: Her bequest of kindness touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent3: The bequest of the enchanted locket brought unexpected magic into their lives.
meanings.sent4: His bequest of courage inspired future generations to be brave.
meanings.sent5: The bequest of the ancient sword held great significance in the family history.
